description: Bathymetry . Dowloaded from GEBCO 2014 (0.0083= 30sec arcmin resolution) and set at resolution 0.1∞. Then completed with the bathymetry layer manually corrected and provided in Fabri-Ruiz et al. (2017)
source: This study. Derived from GEBCO
citation: Fabri-Ruiz S, SaucËède T, Danis B & David B (2017). Southern Ocean Echinoids database_An updated version of Antarctic, Sub-Antarctic and cold temperate echinoid database. ZooKeys, (697), 1.

description: Last update on biodiversity.aq portal. Derived from  O'Brien et al. (2009) seafloor geomorphic feature dataset. Mapping based on GEBCO contours, ETOPO2, seismic lines). 27 categories
source: This study. Derived from Australia Antarctic Data Centre
citation: O'Brien, P.E., Post, A.L., and Romeyn, R. (2009) Antarctic-wide geomorphology as an aid to habitat mapping and locating vulnerable marine ecosystems. CCAMLR VME Workshop 2009. Document WS-VME-09/10

description: Sediment features
source: Griffiths 2014 (unpublished)

description: Derived from bathymetry with the terrain function of raster R package. Computation according to Horn (1981), ie option neighbor=8. The computation was done on the GEBCO bathymetry layer (0.0083∞ resolution) and the resolution was then changed to 0.1∞. Unit set at degrees.
source: This study. Derived from GEBCO
citation: Horn, B.K.P., 1981. Hill shading and the reflectance map. Proceedings of the IEEE 69:14-47

description: Derived from bathymetry with the terrain function of raster R package. Roughness is the difference between the maximum and the minimum value of a cell and its 8 surrounding cells. The computation was done on the GEBCO bathymetry layer (0.0083∞ resolution) and the resolution was then changed to 0.1∞.
source: This study. Derived from GEBCO

description: Summer mixed layer depth climatology from ARGOS data. Regridded from 2-degree grid using nearest neighbour interpolation
source: https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/Polar_Environmental_Data

description: Current speed near the surface (2.5m depth), derived from the CAISOM model (Galton-Fenzi et al. 2012, based on ROMS model)
source: This study. Derived from Australia Antarctic Data Centre
citation: see Galton-Fenzi BK, Hunter JR, Coleman R, Marsland SJ, Warner RC (2012) Modeling the basal melting and marine ice accretion of the Amery Ice Shelf. Journal of Geophysical Research: Oceans, 117, C09031. http://dx.doi.org/10.1029/2012jc008214, https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/polar_environmental_data

description: Current speed near the sea floor, derived from the CAISOM model  (Galton-Fenzi et al. 2012, based on ROMS)
source: This study. Derived from Australia Antarctic Data Centre
citation: see Galton-Fenzi BK, Hunter JR, Coleman R, Marsland SJ, Warner RC (2012) Modeling the basal melting and marine ice accretion of the Amery Ice Shelf.
